title: 【Twitter戰線】香港下議院出咗英文版聲明，快啲話俾全世界知！

replies.msg:
〈Co-signed by over 380 elected council members, the 18 DCs Liaison has released the following statement concerning a “Hong Kong version” of national security law by the National People’s Congress〉

During the deliberation by the National People's Congress (NPC) of a draft Decision on establishing and improving the legal system and enforcement mechanisms for the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) to safeguard national security ("the Decision"), the NPC has proposed to insert national security law into Annex III of Hong Kong Basic Law, hence allowing these Chinese laws to be implemented in the city bypassing the legislature of Hong Kong.

Last year, the HKSAR government relentlessly pushed for amendments to the extradition law, which led to fierce response from the Hongkongers and widespread concern from the international community. Such ineffective governance has caused severe damage to society, especially the increasingly antagonistic relationship between the officials and the people. Now, not only has the power elite refused to reflect on its responsibilities, but it has also collaborated with the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) to circumvent local legislative procedures to further destroy Hong Kong’s remaining liberties. “One Country Two Systems” is now diminished to a mere empty talk.

The 18 DCs Liaison opposes any unjustifiable attempts to change laws for the purpose of restricting democracy and freedom. The NPC “Hong Kong version of national security law” will destroy “One Country Two Systems” and wreck Hong Kong into oblivion. It must be rescinded immediately.

The CCP has repeatedly exploited Annex III of Hong Kong Basic Law. The international community should now know what China’s definition of “upholding promises” means. This time, the push for “Hong Kong version of national security law” has blatantly disregarded her obligations under the Sino-British Joint Declaration. The CCP's action has arisen international awareness, some senior politicians has warned that the new law is a "comprehensive assault" on its rights and freedoms and "cannot be tolerated". The 18 DCs Liaison will continue to exercise our strengths within the local community and join hands with Hongkongers in resisting the CCP’s intrusion into Hong Kong’s values.

18 DCs Liaison
